>**What's going on with Part 1?  What about the rest?**

I thought I sent a really nice, detailed message about what I'd like to see.. ah well, I guess I didn't.

Ideally, the map editor should be a native Windows 32-bit application.

On a technical level, this solves switching the problem of switching video-modes to a dos-based application, caps memory overflows that were a feature of MS-DOS compatability (reduces crashes and incompatabilities, and allows use of the map editor on an NT kernel)

Obviously, this would look similar in style to the current editor; a simple click will drop tiles underneath the mouse cursor. For large maps with huge segments of forests/walls/whatever could be aided with 3x3 or 5x5 "brushes".

BTW -- IIRC someone mentioned a while back that levels couldn't be custom-built.. ie, if you wanted a 5000x200 map, you'd need to use one of the Gladiator-provided levels and modify it, that you couldn't simply create your own. Is this correct? (Um.. If I'm wrong, then... uh... ignore this. ;))

There's more, but that's a start for now.

-George "Cookie" Phillips
Anime News Network
Co-Editor-In-Chief
http://www.animenewsnetwork.com
